intro: Aptandra tubicina, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often hairy and branched. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Aptandra tubicina is often found in rocky soils and is a common sight in desert landscapes.
